content.question: A <math alttext="4 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> object moving to the left collides with and sticks to a <math alttext="3 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> object moving to the right. Just before the collision, the lighter object is moving faster than the heavier object. Which of the following is true of the combined objects immediately after the collision?

choices.label: They must be moving to the left.
They must be moving to the right.
The combined objects' direction of motion, if any, cannot be determined without knowing the ratio of the speeds of the objects before the collision.

content.answer: The combined objects' direction of motion, if any, cannot be determined without knowing the ratio of the speeds of the objects before the collision.
